file_content.text: No Gormak may leave Voss. Control your people or leave, outsider.
Please accept the Empire's sincere apologies. There must have been some misunderstanding.
The dreaming one promised he would help the Gormak find the stars.
The dreaming one promised she would help the Gormak find the stars.
I promised this Gormak I would help him off-planet. I intend to keep my promise.
Yes, I did.
What's going on?
Dreaming one! These corrupt Voss will not let me leave. They say I break their law and block my path.
Pick someplace else for your argument. You're blocking my ship.
Go away, all of you.
The revered visionary Alor-Wan saw this.
You have taken this creature off Voss. We can't allow this. The Voss reject your Empire.
Let's not lose our heads. I'm sure there's a rational explanation. Right, my lord?
I didn't realize it was in violation of your laws. I will send him away.
I'm sorry. My mistake.
No! You promised! I helped you, now you must help me. It is the right thing.
I hadn't realized it was against Voss law. I'm sorry.
I was wrong.
He's telling the truth. I made him a promise, and I'm going to keep it.
You're right.
This will not stand. Consider our relationship dissolved.
Come now. With all due respect, surely one Gormak cannot bring ruin to a civilization as illustrious as your own?
We do not like repeating ourselves. The Gormak cannot go.
Your great civilization flourishes despite near-constant warfare with the Gormak.
Jophen is right.
Imagine how it could flourish if there is peace.
All this Gormak wants is to find peace for his people.
You must let him go. Voss law demands it.
[Force Persuade] Let him pass.
We must let him go. Voss law demands it.
Apologies. Accept this gift as a sign of our friendship. Safe journey.
I have no choice. Someday you'll get a chance to leave, but not today.
Fine. Sorry, Hadrik.
The Gormak have no friends in the galaxy. The Voss corruption touches everyone.
Quiet. You are in Voss custody.
Do not let this happen again.
Shut up. [Kill him.]
There. No more Gormak off Voss. Happy?
There. Heh. See. Just a misunderstanding. But I think we've cleaned that up nicely.
I can personally assure it will not happen again.
We accept this death as a sign of friendship. Do not test us.
Whew. That was close. Thank you, my lord, for clearing that up.
This Gormak wants peace for his people and yours.
This is the right thing to do.
Give the Gormak a chance to explore the galaxy and make allies.
In time, they will leave you alone, and you will both be free to flourish.
The visions are never wrong. They say the Gormak will disappear from Voss.
Our allies must respect our laws.
I assure you, it will not happen again.
It was a one-time thing.
We take you at your word.
Whew. You're a smooth-talker, my lord. I don't know how you pulled that off.
Might be best if you left now, though. The sooner the Voss forget about this little incident, the better.
Forget this whole thing ever happened.
[Force Persuade] Forget it.
We will forget this. There are no grudges between friends.
Exactly. That's what I always say.
You can relax; I doubt I'll be returning to Voss any time soon.
You needn't worry. I'm gone.
What?
What he means to say is, we all have the utmost respect for your laws.
What she means to say is, we all have the utmost respect for your laws.
Now it so happens that my brother is working at the factory where they've developed a new kind of droid....
My master, let's leave this strange place behind us.
Had enough of it, Khem? I don't blame you.
Agreed.
How about we get out of here while we still can, huh?
That's the smartest thing you've ever said, Andronikos.
Agreed.
This would seem like an excellent time to pack up our tools and move site, don't you think?
An excellent idea, Talos.
Agreed.
My lord, are we finished here?
Yes, I think we are.
Of course.
I got what I wanted. Let the Voss figure it out.
I'm done with these people.
The sooner we get off this world the better, I think.
I can't wait to leave.
Don't worry about these guys, my lord. I'll take care of them. Though, you might want to duck out until this whole thing dies down.
I don't see any Gormak here. You came here to help me.
[Force Persuade] What Gormak?
I don't see any Gormak here. Strange. Ah. I came here to help.
Accept this gift as a sign of friendship. Safe journey.
Unbelievable. How did you do that?
I am a Lord of the Sith. There is no limit to my power.
Don't underestimate my power.
Of course. How stupid of me.
I have my charms.
I didn't doubt that, of course, but that was very impressive.
It was nothing special.
[Force Persuade] Forget it.
It was nothing special. Right. What was I thinking?
Once again, it's been a pleasure. Good luck out there.
The revered Mystic visionary Alor-Wan has seen your path.
A vision says you will bring destruction to the Voss way of life. Turn back.
You'll hardly notice I'm here, I assure you.
Don't worry about me.
I refuse.
How do you know this vision is correct?
You seem awfully convinced.
The visionaries always see the truth.
Outsiders are often confused. We ask once more: leave Voss be.
Not that it'll make a difference, but what if I refuse?
And if I don't leave?
I am a Lord of the Sith. You will have to do more than scold me.
Stop me.
I, too, have seen the truth: I must complete my mission on Voss.
I'm following my own vision.
Outsiders do not receive visions.
The revered Mystic visionary Alor-Wan has seen that we must not use force to dissuade you.
You will not destroy Voss. There are other means of persuasion.
